scenario_text.value: Looks like the gym is up ahead.

Hnnnnnngh! Boy, I can’t get this door to move
an inch!

It’s no good, we can’t figure out the source
of the sound unless we open the door.
Let’s check other places for now.
Is there anywhere else we can look?
Aoi is in there! I can feel it!
Really?!

No doubt about it! I’d never mistake her
presence for someone else!

Okay, so we know she’s in there at least!
Hold on, Aoi, we’re coming to save you!
...Damn, the door won’t budge!

I don’t see a lock anywhere.
Is it those spiderwebs?!
What should we do, Takuma?!

What do I do... What do I do?! She’s just on
the other side of this, and yet...

I have to protect her... Why can’t I protect
her...?!

(Poor Labramon... Her precious person is so
close, and she can’t do anything about it.)
(What should I do for Labramon?)
I should talk to her.
Maybe I’ll keep quiet.

It’ll be okay, Labramon. If we work together,
we’ll definitely rescue her.
B-but how? We can’t get past this door...

That’s...hmm. Well, the enemy has to get out
of there, so maybe there’s another path?
Oh! Yeah, that makes sense!

There must be another way in! I’ll try and
sniff it out!

(Shoot, I don’t know how to comfort her.
I think anything I say will make her sad.)
(I should think of a way to get over there...)

Hmm... I think this has been blocked off for
a while. Maybe there’s another way in?
What? You think so?!
Really?! Okay, I’ll go sniff it out!
Ah, wait, Labramon!
Wah?!

(Huh, I got a message? But how? I thought the
camera was the only thing working.)

(What the—? This doesn’t make any sense.
It’s just a string of random symbols.)
Something wrong, Takuma?
Uh, nope! Just forget about it.

(Who’d send a message like this? I’d better
put it on the back burner for now.)
Let’s go look too, Agumon!
Way ahead of you!
